numbered_ace_sentences: 2. A legacy applicant has a parent who attended the college.
3. Some legacy applicants have parents with a higher income.
4. A legacy applicant with a higher-income parent has a higher chance of acceptance than a poorer applicant.
5. A legacy applicant with a higher-income parent has a higher chance of acceptance than a regular applicant.
6. I wonder why it is more important to accept a legacy applicant.
7. A child is not always similar to the parent of the child.
8. There is no guarantee that a legacy applicant is similar to the parent of the legacy applicant.
9. A legacy applicant can be less academic than the parent of the legacy applicant.
10. I am not a legacy applicant.
11. A person who is not a legacy applicant has a lower chance of acceptance than a legacy applicant.
13. I need to start looking for colleges.
14. If I am not a legacy applicant then my college options will be affected greatly.
15. The headline is: Status over Smarts?: Is being a legacy applicant more important than being academically smart?
